New Records: Jaden Hardy led the Mavericks with a season-high 25 points
Dereck Lively II added a season-high 21 points and a season-high 16 rebounds
Key Match Events: The Mavericks exploded for 36 points in the fourth quarter and ended the game on a 17-2 run
P.J. Washington tapped into his clutch gene and drained the go-ahead corner 3-pointer to give Dallas a three-point lead
Quentin Grimes sealed the victory after a three-point play
Pre-Game Insights: Mavericks coach Jason Kidd addressed the earlier tipoff time during his pregame press conference
Portland Trail Blazers coach Chauncey Billups was well aware of Hardy’s recent surge from beyond the 3-point line entering Thursday’s game
Post-Match Reflections: With the win, the Mavericks have won their last two games without Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving
The Mavericks clinched the season series against the Blazers 3-1
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game’s start time was moved up an hour due to snowy weather across the Metroplex
The first 5,000 fans in attendance who braved the weather conditions received Daniel Gafford pins
The Blazers will return home to face the Heat on Saturday, while the Mavericks will host the Denver Nuggets in the first of two consecutive games on Sunday
